content.raw: That's exactly right. Technically speaking, the `static_assert` in `FeaureList` will never get triggered, because if there is ever a conflict, then the compiler will exit at the embedded `static_assert`. But we need that outer `static_assert` to be in the `FeatureList` class template definition to make sure that the embedded `static_assert` is reached by the compiler for every instantiation of a `FeatureList`.

Technically speaking, the static_assert in FeaureList will never get triggered, because if there is ever a conflict, then the compiler will exit at the embedded static_assert. But we need that outer static_assert to be in the FeatureList class template definition to make sure that the embedded static_assert is reached by the compiler for every instantiation of a FeatureList.
